Allow access only to specific instances: Allow access only to specific instances
Apply access rights for selected instanc: Apply access rights for selected instances to selected user
Background color of the login screen: Background color of the login screen
Set certificates or load it first in the: Set certificates or define it first in the system settings (right top).
Unsecure_Auth: The password will be sent unencrypted via an unsecure connection. To protect your passwords enable the secure connection (HTTPS)!
Use this instance for automatic update: Use this instance for automatic certificate update
explain_access_instance: In Easy Mode you can allow access to specific configuration pages of selected instances only.
tooltip_auth: Require an usename and password to access the admin page. Users can be managed on the users tab.
tooltip_bind: IP address where the admin instance will listen on
tooltip_certChained: Chained certificate. Root certificate + Public certificate. Use ioBroker system configuration to manage available certificates.
tooltip_certPrivate: Private certificate. Use ioBroker system configuration to manage available certificates.
tooltip_certPublic: Public certificate. Use ioBroker system configuration to manage available certificates.
tooltip_lePort: Port for challenge server. Because Let's Encrypt requires to use port 80 from external, you need to configure a port forwarding rule to the port defined here.
tooltip_leUpdate: This instance will update Let's Encrypt certificates every 3 months
tooltip_port: Port for admin interface. It must not be used by any other process. If running on linux with no root you cannot use ports below 1000.
tooltip_secure: Enable SSL protocol. Admin will be available via https:// and not http://
tooltip_thresholdValue: If the browser receives too many events and data updates within 3 seconds, the data refresh will be temporarily stopped
tooltip_ttl: Login Session duration. After this time the user will be logged off automatically.
There is a option to allow access to the: There is a option to allow access to the specific configuration pages of selected instances.
No data in history for selected period: No data in history for selected period
